intro: Hieracium subprolixum, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Hieracium subprolixum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
